meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she luged down the icy hill with her friends.
meanings.sent2: They luged together in the winter Olympics last year.
meanings.sent3: The penguin luged gracefully on the frozen pond.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts luged through his mind like a speeding train.
meanings.sent5: The sled luged down the slope at breakneck speed.

meanings.definition: simple past tense and past participle of luge
meanings.sent1: She has luged down this track many times before.
meanings.sent2: They luged effortlessly through the twists and turns.
meanings.sent3: The cat luged across the hardwood floor, chasing a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her voice luged up and down the musical scale.
meanings.sent5: The car luged smoothly around the sharp corner.
